result.execSummary:
The defendant Melanie R Desouto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 3 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Manitowoc County.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is to be determined.

AMENDED 12-02-2016:  Restitution is ordered in the amount of $240.13 payable to the victim (L.D.F.).  To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Court costs are to be paid as Condition of Probation.  Court waives DNA sample and surcharge.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No violent contact with the victim (L.D.) or the victim's family.
Defendant to contact DOC by 09:00 a.m. on 09-26-2016.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   
Defendant Melanie R Desouto did not appear.   
Case scheduled for 1:30 pm. and Matter called @ 2:01 pm.

Defendant Melanie R Desouto in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  
Court to address - Active Warrant - For Non-Appearance.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
DV enhancer is struck.
Count 1 will be dismissed as a read in.


Court orders the following:
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
3 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 1 Year.
Court will allow for transfer to Manitowoc County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent contact with:  victim (LD) or her victim's family.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.
Defendant will need to contact DOC by 9 am. on Monday - 09/26/16.

Costs:  $243

To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Restitution being requested is $240.13 to L.D. and $1,293.67 to the Rawlings Group.
